page.title: 19Housing in the Meir
page.content: The majority of houses in the Meir area are Council houses which were built from 1930 onwards.These houses are usually semi-detached but sometimes terraced rows of up to six houses were built.There has been in recent years construction of modern private houses on the outskirts of Meir but the area is one of predominantly Council homes. Each house has a garden and normally a garage.The average size of house is three bedrooms,living room, kitchen,inside W.C. and bathroom.They arup of redbrick with grey/black clay tiled roofs. Lots of open space has been left in the Meir to provide recreation for children There are lots of open greens where games can be played.
